message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public static int findMin(ArrayList<Integer> numbers) {
    if (numbers.size() == 1) {
        return numbers.get(0);
    } else {
        int first = numbers.get(0);
        int restMin = findMin(new ArrayList<>(numbers.subList(1, numbers.size())));
        return Math.min(first, restMin);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This recursive method uses the concept of divide and conquer. It compares the first element of the ArrayList with the minimum value of the rest of the ArrayList (obtained by recursively calling the method with a sublist of the original ArrayList). The minimum value is then returned.
